avalancheActivity.highlights: Regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable): In these regions the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow of the last two days as well as the wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in some places. Small to medium-sized natural dry avalanches are possible.
Faceted weak layers exist in the old snowpack. Avalanches can in some cases be triggered in near-ground layers.
In particular at intermediate and high altitudes rather small wind slabs formed. Caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes, especially at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In particular along the border with Italy 5 to 15 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell on Sunday.
In some localities 5 to 20 cm of snow will fall on Monday above approximately 2000 m.
The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

avalancheActivity.highlights: The avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are therefore barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.
avalancheActivity.comment:
Little snow will fall on Monday.
Wind slabs can sometimes be released by a single winter sport participant. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and in places that are protected from the wind. Especially at intermediate and high altitudes these avalanche prone locations are more widespread. They are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility, caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for restraint.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 5 to 10 cm of snow, but less in some localities, fell on Sunday. The moderate wind has transported the new snow. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack. Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.
The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations. In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2000 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable): In these regions the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent and the danger is slightly greater.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow of the last two days as well as the wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in some places. Small to medium-sized natural dry avalanches are possible.
Fresh wind slabs can be released. This applies in particular on very steep slopes. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
Individual weak layers exist in the old snowpack. These avalanche prone locations are barely recognisable, even to the trained eye, caution is to be exercised in particular in areas where the snow cover is rather shallow,, this also applies in places that are protected from the wind, this also applies in little used backcountry terrain.

snowpackStructure.comment:
5 to 20 cm of snow will fall on Monday.
Especially along the border with Italy and in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable) 10 to 15 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell on Sunday above approximately 2000 m.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack. Weak layers exist in the old snowpack especially on shady slopes.
The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations.
At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.
